table.task: Use AccessiList with a mouse, keyboard, and/or assistive techonolgy.
table.info: Built with accessibility best practices from the ground up. All features available to keyboard-only users, and the assistive technologies that use standard keyboard commands.

table.task: Save your list and return anytime with your 3-digit key. No account needed.
table.info: Each list you create has a 3-digit key with numbers and/or letters. Your key is unique and is found at the end of the web address for your list. For example: https://webaim.org/training/online/accessilist/?=AAA.

table.task: Tasks are organized into 'Checkpoints', which group tasks by common objective, and you can add custom tasks.
table.info: Add your own tasks using the add row ([add row default CSS]) button found after the last task row in every checkpoint. Add as many as you need.

table.task: Track progress with three indicators: Ready ([ready-1.svg]) → Active ([active-1.svg]) → Done ([done-1.svg]).
table.info: Click buttons in the Status column to update your progress.to move to the next level. Check your progress at a glance with color-coded, labeled icons.

table.task: View a report showing all completed tasks across all checkpoints.
table.info: Click the Report ([Report default CSS]) button in the header to view your progress summary and completed items.

table.task: Tasks are designed by accessibility experts and organized into checkpoints by common objective.
table.info: Each checklist (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.) contains tasks specific to that tool. Tasks are grouped into checkpoints to help you tackle related items together.

table.task: Try clicking the Info ([info-.svg]) button for any task in Checkpoint 1 above.
table.info: In this tutorial, additional information is provided about each statement or instruction. In the actual checklists, clicking the Info button will provide you with additional resources related to the task.

table.task: You can add your own tasks to each checkpoint table. Add a custom task to this table by clicking the Add Row ([add row selected CSS]) button below.
table.info: Each checkpoint will have an Add Row ([add row selected CSS]) button located right below the table. After adding a row, add your Task, and Notes (optional).

table.task: Use the Notes column to record details, reminders, and other information for each task.
table.info: Notes are for your personal use and are saved with your list. Some ideas for using Notes are: record new things that you learned from working on the task; document collaborators and their assignments; document questions you have about the task to research.

table.task: Click in the Note's field and start typing something.
table.info: You'll see your text appear as you type. All notes are automatically saved when you leave the field.

table.task: Did you notice that adding a note automatically changes the Status to "Active ([active-1.svg])"?
table.info: AccessiList assumes that if you're taking notes on a task, you're actively working on it. The status automatically updates from Ready to Active when you add notes. See "Status" checkpoint below for more information on tracking your progress.

table.task: Notes fields expand as you type, and support multiple lines of text.
table.info: Press Enter to create a new line in your notes. The field will automatically grow to accommodate longer content. There's no character limit. If the text is beyond the visible area, a scroll bar will appear.

table.task: Your notes are private and only visible when you return with your unique 3-digit key.
table.info: Only someone with your exact 3-digit key can view or edit them. No account needed, no login required.

table.task: Track your progress with three status levels: Ready ([ready-1.svg]), Active ([active-1.svg]), and Done ([done-1.svg]).
table.info: Each task starts as Ready ([ready-1.svg]). Click the status button to cycle through: Ready ([ready-1.svg]) → Active ([active-1.svg]) → Done ([done-1.svg]) → Ready ([ready-1.svg]). The icons and colors change to show your progress at a glance.

table.task: Click the Ready ([ready-1.svg])Status button for this task to see it change to Active ([active-1.svg]).
table.info: The status is automatically saved each time you click the button to change it.

table.task: Adding notes to a task automatically updates its status to Active ([active-1.svg]).
table.info: If a task is marked Ready ([ready-1.svg]) and you add a note, the status automatically changes to Active ([active-1.svg]). This helps you track which tasks you're currently working on.

table.task: Use the Done ([done-1.svg]) status to mark tasks as complete, and show the Reset ([reset.svg]) button.
table.info: Tasks marked Done ([done-1.svg]) are highlighted in your Report ([Report default CSS]) page. This gives you a quick summary of all completed work across all checkpoints.
